result.execSummary:
The defendant Kdeion Nasean Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge paid in full from bond.

Consec to 20CF971. To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).
Consecutive to: 20CF971

*TAKEN INTO CUSTODY*

Argued sentencing. State recommending 6 months DCJ cs to 20CF971 and any other sentence. Statement by DE. DNA on file.

Victim Rights Compliance

The Court sentences Defendant to:

-Days credit to jail:  12
